column4: do i just go in synaptic and install nfs to enable file sharing?
what are you trying to do?
just repeat what you did on the xbuntu box i would think :)
i sorted it out, it was even easier in ubuntu than xubuntu
and what did you have to do in xubuntu that differed then buntu?
in xubuntu i had to set it up to enable network file share as in ubuntu it was enabled by default
settings settings settings it's always something simple isn't it
was proably ALOT easier then any other machines you networked i bet :)
are you using a hub or switch?
both machines are connected to the same gateway
uh, you said hub or switch
it might be a router i've got
been though that bull crap many times buy a switch and use seperate card for it
the only folder that appears when i try to access the machine is "PRINT$"
check that you can ping both machines on both computers FIRST.. if thats a go your fine if not get a timeout error you need to check network equpment
that sounds like kinda wierd a port to plug a network print server read your router docs
